question: Which of the following is not a factor affecting the supply of a commodity?
explanation:
The supply of a commodity by a firm refers to the quantity of the commodity which the firm is willing to supply at a particular price and time.
Factors affecting supply:
(1) Price of the commodity itself
(2) Change in the technology of production
(3) Change in price of inputs
(4) Change in excise duty
(5) Price of other related goods
